body_html: This is currently unsupported. You can just try renaming the wheel (which is how we generate our python 3.6 binary). Until Python 3.7 is an actual release (not beta, alpha) we will not support it. You can of course build for it .from source, but you may run into problems you need to fix. Is there a compelling reason to use Python 3.7 instead of 3.6?

body: This is currently unsupported. You can just try renaming the wheel (which is how we generate our python 3.6 binary). Until Python 3.7 is an actual release (not beta, alpha) we will not support it. You can of course build for it .from source, but you may run into problems you need to fix. Is there a compelling reason to use Python 3.7 instead of 3.6?
